meanings.definition: A sudden breaking off or interruption in a process.
meanings.sent1: The abruptions in the power supply caused the computer to shut down unexpectedly.
meanings.sent2: The earthquake caused abruptions in the communication lines, disrupting the phone service.
meanings.sent3: The abruptions in the movie plot kept the audience on the edge of their seats.
meanings.sent4: Her sudden departure created abruptions in our daily routine, leaving us disoriented.
meanings.sent5: The abruptions in the music added an element of surprise to the performance.

meanings.definition: A sharp or rough break in a surface.
meanings.sent1: The hiker stumbled over the abruptions in the rocky terrain.
meanings.sent2: The artist captured the abruptions in the cliff face with intricate detail.
meanings.sent3: The abruptions in the road made the drive a bumpy adventure.
meanings.sent4: The abruptions in the ice resembled jagged teeth jutting out of the frozen lake.
meanings.sent5: The abruptions in the fabric created a unique texture in the design.
